infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov
Class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti

java.lang.Object
  infodynamics.measures.continuous.TransferEntropyCommon
      infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.TransferEntropyCalculatorKraskovByMulti
          infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChannelCalculator, ChannelCalculatorCommon, ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate, TransferEntropyCalculator, TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
Direct Known Subclasses:
TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskov
public class TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKraskovByMulti
extends TransferEntropyCalculatorKraskovByMulti
implements TransferEntropyCalculatorMultiVariate

Compute the Transfer Entropy using the Kraskov estimation method.

This calculator extends the TransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov by allowing multivariate sources and destinations. See TransferEntropyCalculatorKraskov for further comments on the implementation of Transfer entropy via the Kraskov Mutual Information estimation.

Author:
Joseph Lizier; joseph.lizier at gmail.com

Sets the observations to compute the PDFs from. Cannot be called in conjunction with start/add/finaliseAddObservations. destValid is a time series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether the destination at that point is valid. sourceValid is the same for the source

Description copied from interface: ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate

Sets the single set of observations to compute the PDFs from. Cannot be called in conjunction with ChannelCalculatorCommon.startAddObservations()/#addObservations(double[], double[]) / ChannelCalculatorCommon.finaliseAddObservations().

Specified by:
setObservations in interface ChannelCalculatorMultiVariate
Parameters:
source - multivariate observations for the source variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
destination - multivariate observations for the destination variable (first index is time, second is variable number)
sourceValid - time series (with time indices the same as source) indicating whether each variable of the source at that point is valid.
destValid - time series (with time indices the same as destination) indicating whether each variable of the destination at that point is valid.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

makeJointVectorForNextPast

protected double[][] makeJointVectorForNextPast(double[][] destination)
Generate a vector for each time step, containing the past k states of the destination, and the current state. Does not include a vector for the first k time steps.
